info.name: Vlocity Digital Commerce APIs Collection
info.description:
Vlocity Digital Commerce APIs are RESTful Web APIs designed to enable client applications such as consumer-facing web and mobile apps to shop for products and services. The Digital Commerce APIs are optimized for consumer shopping use cases where the user may be anonymous until well into the check-out process. These APIs are also optimized to enable caching of API responses to provide performance enhancements and scalability. Finally, these APIs are optimized for lower bandwidth connections between the client app and the server by minimizing the metadata returned in the response.
The Digital Commerce APIs are provided in addition to the Vlocity Cart Based APIs. The Cart Based APIs are optimized for highly interactive cart operations done by contact center agents and sales reps using an editor such as the Vlocity Cart UI. Therefore, Cart Based APIs provide more metadata to the client browser enabling a wide array of operations. Both the Cart Based CPQ APIs and the Digital Commerce APIs will continue to be supported and actively enhanced. The Digital Commerce APIs are not intended to replace the Cart based APIs.

All of the Vlocity Omnichannel REST APIs simplify client app development by hiding the details of internal  CPQ processing. Client-side developers do not need to understand details of the underlying CPQ logic: no need to know the proper order to apply eligibility and availability rules and no need to learn the methods of the  underlying CPQ rules engines and other CPQ services. 
_________________________

The basic flow of API calls with the digital commerce APIs is as follows:
1. Get eligible offers from a catalog: GET /v3/catalogs/{catalogcode}/offers
2. Get the details of a specific offer retrieved from the previous call: GET /v3/catalogs/{catalogcode}/offers/{offercode}
3. Get the details of a specific offer with attribute values specified: POST /v3/catalogs/{catalogcode}/offers/{offercode}

The above APIs retrieve eligible offers (products and/or promotions) from the specified catalog based on the customer context provided in the request, but these APIs only return default "starts-with" and base pricing information. To request more specific pricing and feedback on the validity of the configured bundle, use the basket APIs that follow.

4. Get a basket containing a configured offer bundle using an offer details response (3 above): POST /v3/catalogs/{catalogcode}/basket
5. Get a modification of the previous basket adding another bundle or deleting a bundle: POST /v3/catalogs/{catalogcode}/basket/{basketkey}

The basket APIs get specific pricing for the context given by executing the Vlocity CPQ pricing services. The API returns a basket key that is a hash form of a cart containing the chosen items as configured.

6. Create a cart in Salesforce for a specific customer using the basket response (4 or 5 above): POST /v3/carts

query.description: A Product Code (Product2.ProductCode) that is contained within one or more composite or bundle offers. Use to query for  offers containing the desired component product such as an iPhone8. The sortby parameter (thus sorting) is not supported with the contains parameter in Fall '18.
Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user
Page size of results defined as the number of offers to return.  Default pagesize can be set in the server (Vlocity API Metadata > API Params).

Offset of results to return. This is used along with pagination to request a specific page of results. For example, an offset value of 40 and pagesize of 20 will request that the server return the third page of  offers. In other words, it should return 20 offers starting from the 40th offer in the complete list. If not specified in request, offset defaults to 1, but this can be overridden in the server (Vlocity API Metadata > API Params).
Name of Catalog Product Relationship field to sort by. Defaults to Sequence (Catalog Product Relationship > Sequence Number).

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).

request.description: Get offers from the specified Catalog (identified by Catalog Code). Offers can be a product or a promotion (and in the future a product with an applied promotion). The sortby param  can sort featured offers first in the result set.

query.description: A Product Code (Product2.ProductCode) that is contained within one or more composite or bundle offers. Use to query for  offers containing the desired component product such as an iPhone8. The sortby parameter (thus sorting) is not supported with the contains parameter in Fall '18.
Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user
Page size of results defined as the number of offers to return.  Default pagesize can be set in the server (Vlocity API Metadata > API Params).

Offset of results to return. This is used along with pagination to request a specific page of results. For example, an offset value of 40 and pagesize of 20 will request that the server return the third page of  offers. In other words, it should return 20 offers starting from the 40th offer in the complete list. If not specified in request, offset defaults to 1, but this can be overridden in the server (Vlocity API Metadata > API Params).
Name of Catalog Product Relationship field to sort by. Defaults to Sequence (Catalog Product Relationship > Sequence Number).

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).

request.description: Get offers from the specified Catalog (identified by Catalog Code). Offers can be a product or a promotion (and in the future a product with an applied promotion). The sortby param  can sort featured offers first in the result set.

query.description: Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).
Identifies an offer of interest. Can be a Product Code or a Promo Code (GET only). (PRODUCTCODE+PROMOCODE and PROMOCODE ie addPromo cannot be supported for v103.)

request.description: Get detailed info about a specific offer (product or promotion). It returns the full  hierarchy of a product or promotion as defined in the product catalog.

query.description: Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).
Identifies an offer of interest. Can be a Product Code or a Promo Code (GET only). (PRODUCTCODE+PROMOCODE and PROMOCODE ie addPromo cannot be supported for v103.)

request.description: Get detailed info about a specific offer. Accepts a configuration of the chosen  offer (quantity and attribute values) to enable validation and  pricing of that configuration. If the basketKey is passed in the input, it'll honour the rules on the basket items which can affect the offer configuration.

query.description: Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

A flag which describes if the basket api should return attachments or not. The default value is false. If includeAttachment is true, the basket api returns the attachments.  If the isloggedin flag is false,the basket api does not return the attachments.

This flag indicates whether to return basket in the AssetToBasket DC api response.  The default value is true. So the assettobasket api will return the basket as earlier(backward compatible).  If it is set to false, the assettobasket api will return only the basket key, not the complete basket.

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).

request.description:
Create a basket containing an offer bundle using one of three methods:
1. Pass basketAction = AddWithNoConfig and offer = Offer Code to add the offer without any configured attribute values.
2. Pass basketAction = AddAfterConfig and productConfig = result from Get Offer Details API to add a configured offer.
3. Pass basketAction = AssetToBasket and rootAssetIds = the root assets Ids and requestDateTime = the requested date time

response.name: successful operation

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AddWithNoConfig', OfferCode to be added or deleted

Defines the action to take to create the basket. Options are:
* AddWithNoConfig - use when passing Offer Code only * AddAfterConfig - use when passing productConfig * AssetToBasket - use when doing a MACD * DeleteFromBasket - use when passing deleteBundleNumber to get a modified basket without the specified bundle
Optional continuation key to be passed. (Recommended to use multiTransactionKey from CMT105)

Optional transactionkey to be passed if the api requires more than one transaction. In case of cache miss, the api may need more than one transaction to complete in order to avoid hitting the salesforce governing limits( SOQL, DML, heap size, cpu time). So in order to handle that, the api will break when any of the above configured salesforce governing limit is exceeded and it will return the multiTransactionKey. So the UI can invoke the same API again with the multiTransactionKey and the API will proceed from previous step. The configured salesforce governing limits are configurable through following custom settings - SOQL - NumberOfQueriesPerTransaction DML - NumberOfDMLPerTransaction CPU Time - MaxCPUTimePerTransaction Heap Size - MaxHeapSizePerTransaction

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', requested date-time for the Asset To Basket
Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', comma separated list of root asset ids

Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', performs check whether we can create a basket for the requested date. So you can not create a basket for a previous date (for example 1st July 2020) if there a open order with higher request date (for example 1st August 2020). Default value is false. If it is false, then the above check is not performed.
Required when basketAction = 'AddWithNoConfig', OfferCode to be added or deleted

Defines the action to take to create the basket. Options are:
* AddWithNoConfig - use when passing Offer Code only * AddAfterConfig - use when passing productConfig * AssetToBasket - use when doing a MACD * DeleteFromBasket - use when passing deleteBundleNumber to get a modified basket without the specified bundle
Optional continuation key to be passed. (Recommended to use multiTransactionKey from CMT105)

Optional transactionkey to be passed if the api requires more than one transaction. In case of cache miss, the api may need more than one transaction to complete in order to avoid hitting the salesforce governing limits( SOQL, DML, heap size, cpu time). So in order to handle that, the api will break when any of the above configured salesforce governing limit is exceeded and it will return the multiTransactionKey. So the UI can invoke the same API again with the multiTransactionKey and the API will proceed from previous step. The configured salesforce governing limits are configurable through following custom settings - SOQL - NumberOfQueriesPerTransaction DML - NumberOfDMLPerTransaction CPU Time - MaxCPUTimePerTransaction Heap Size - MaxHeapSizePerTransaction

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', requested date-time for the Asset To Basket
Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', comma separated list of root asset ids

Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', performs check whether we can create a basket for the requested date. So you can not create a basket for a previous date (for example 1st July 2020) if there a open order with higher request date (for example 1st August 2020). Default value is false. If it is false, then the above check is not performed.

query.description: Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

A flag which describes if the basket api should return attachments or not. The default value is false. If includeAttachment is true, the basket api returns the attachments.  If the isloggedin flag is false,the basket api does not return the attachments.

This flag indicates whether to return basket in the AssetToBasket DC api response.  The default value is true. So the assettobasket api will return the basket as earlier(backward compatible).  If it is set to false, the assettobasket api will return only the basket key, not the complete basket.

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).

request.description:
Create a basket containing an offer bundle using one of three methods:
1. Pass basketAction = AddWithNoConfig and offer = Offer Code to add the offer without any configured attribute values.
2. Pass basketAction = AddAfterConfig and productConfig = result from Get Offer Details API to add a configured offer.
3. Pass basketAction = AssetToBasket and rootAssetIds = the root assets Ids and requestDateTime = the requested date time

response.name: successful operation

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AddWithNoConfig', OfferCode to be added or deleted

Defines the action to take to create the basket. Options are:
* AddWithNoConfig - use when passing Offer Code only * AddAfterConfig - use when passing productConfig * AssetToBasket - use when doing a MACD * DeleteFromBasket - use when passing deleteBundleNumber to get a modified basket without the specified bundle
Optional continuation key to be passed. (Recommended to use multiTransactionKey from CMT105)

Optional transactionkey to be passed if the api requires more than one transaction. In case of cache miss, the api may need more than one transaction to complete in order to avoid hitting the salesforce governing limits( SOQL, DML, heap size, cpu time). So in order to handle that, the api will break when any of the above configured salesforce governing limit is exceeded and it will return the multiTransactionKey. So the UI can invoke the same API again with the multiTransactionKey and the API will proceed from previous step. The configured salesforce governing limits are configurable through following custom settings - SOQL - NumberOfQueriesPerTransaction DML - NumberOfDMLPerTransaction CPU Time - MaxCPUTimePerTransaction Heap Size - MaxHeapSizePerTransaction

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', requested date-time for the Asset To Basket
Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', comma separated list of root asset ids

Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', performs check whether we can create a basket for the requested date. So you can not create a basket for a previous date (for example 1st July 2020) if there a open order with higher request date (for example 1st August 2020). Default value is false. If it is false, then the above check is not performed.
Required when basketAction = 'AddWithNoConfig', OfferCode to be added or deleted

Defines the action to take to create the basket. Options are:
* AddWithNoConfig - use when passing Offer Code only * AddAfterConfig - use when passing productConfig * AssetToBasket - use when doing a MACD * DeleteFromBasket - use when passing deleteBundleNumber to get a modified basket without the specified bundle
Optional continuation key to be passed. (Recommended to use multiTransactionKey from CMT105)

Optional transactionkey to be passed if the api requires more than one transaction. In case of cache miss, the api may need more than one transaction to complete in order to avoid hitting the salesforce governing limits( SOQL, DML, heap size, cpu time). So in order to handle that, the api will break when any of the above configured salesforce governing limit is exceeded and it will return the multiTransactionKey. So the UI can invoke the same API again with the multiTransactionKey and the API will proceed from previous step. The configured salesforce governing limits are configurable through following custom settings - SOQL - NumberOfQueriesPerTransaction DML - NumberOfDMLPerTransaction CPU Time - MaxCPUTimePerTransaction Heap Size - MaxHeapSizePerTransaction

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', requested date-time for the Asset To Basket
Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', comma separated list of root asset ids

Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', performs check whether we can create a basket for the requested date. So you can not create a basket for a previous date (for example 1st July 2020) if there a open order with higher request date (for example 1st August 2020). Default value is false. If it is false, then the above check is not performed.

query.description: Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}
For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

A flag which describes if the basket api should return attachments or not. The default value is false. If includeAttachment is true, the basket api returns the attachments.  If the isloggedin flag is false,the basket api does not return the attachments.

This flag indicates whether to return basket in the AssetToBasket DC api response.  The default value is true. So the assettobasket api will return the basket as earlier(backward compatible).  If it is set to false, the assettobasket api will return only the basket key, not the complete basket.

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).

request.description:
Create a basket containing an offer bundle using one of three methods:
1. Pass basketAction = AddWithNoConfig and offer = Offer Code to add the offer without any configured attribute values.
2. Pass basketAction = AddAfterConfig and productConfig = result from Get Offer Details API to add a configured offer.
3. Pass basketAction = AssetToBasket and rootAssetIds = the root assets Ids and requestDateTime = the requested date time

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AddWithNoConfig', OfferCode to be added or deleted

Defines the action to take to create the basket. Options are:
* AddWithNoConfig - use when passing Offer Code only * AddAfterConfig - use when passing productConfig * AssetToBasket - use when doing a MACD * DeleteFromBasket - use when passing deleteBundleNumber to get a modified basket without the specified bundle
Optional continuation key to be passed. (Recommended to use multiTransactionKey from CMT105)

Optional transactionkey to be passed if the api requires more than one transaction. In case of cache miss, the api may need more than one transaction to complete in order to avoid hitting the salesforce governing limits( SOQL, DML, heap size, cpu time). So in order to handle that, the api will break when any of the above configured salesforce governing limit is exceeded and it will return the multiTransactionKey. So the UI can invoke the same API again with the multiTransactionKey and the API will proceed from previous step. The configured salesforce governing limits are configurable through following custom settings - SOQL - NumberOfQueriesPerTransaction DML - NumberOfDMLPerTransaction CPU Time - MaxCPUTimePerTransaction Heap Size - MaxHeapSizePerTransaction

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', requested date-time for the Asset To Basket
Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', comma separated list of root asset ids

Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', performs check whether we can create a basket for the requested date. So you can not create a basket for a previous date (for example 1st July 2020) if there a open order with higher request date (for example 1st August 2020). Default value is false. If it is false, then the above check is not performed.

response.name: successful operation

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AddWithNoConfig', OfferCode to be added or deleted

Defines the action to take to create the basket. Options are:
* AddWithNoConfig - use when passing Offer Code only * AddAfterConfig - use when passing productConfig * AssetToBasket - use when doing a MACD * DeleteFromBasket - use when passing deleteBundleNumber to get a modified basket without the specified bundle
Optional continuation key to be passed. (Recommended to use multiTransactionKey from CMT105)

Optional transactionkey to be passed if the api requires more than one transaction. In case of cache miss, the api may need more than one transaction to complete in order to avoid hitting the salesforce governing limits( SOQL, DML, heap size, cpu time). So in order to handle that, the api will break when any of the above configured salesforce governing limit is exceeded and it will return the multiTransactionKey. So the UI can invoke the same API again with the multiTransactionKey and the API will proceed from previous step. The configured salesforce governing limits are configurable through following custom settings - SOQL - NumberOfQueriesPerTransaction DML - NumberOfDMLPerTransaction CPU Time - MaxCPUTimePerTransaction Heap Size - MaxHeapSizePerTransaction

description.content: Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', requested date-time for the Asset To Basket
Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', comma separated list of root asset ids

Required when basketAction = 'AssetToBasket', performs check whether we can create a basket for the requested date. So you can not create a basket for a previous date (for example 1st July 2020) if there a open order with higher request date (for example 1st August 2020). Default value is false. If it is false, then the above check is not performed.

query.description: Context key (e.g. 784b264ea6dc63690369e721ffd8e112) which describes the anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. Use if the customer's context key is known.

if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}

variable.description: Identifies the catalog of interest to a customer, prospect or partner. This defines the  collection of offers to present to the users and sets a default price list and locale(lang).

For debugging purposes, TRUE will force a cache refresh for this key. This parameter only works when a server setting enables forceinvalidatecache to be set from the API.

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

A flag which describes if the basket api should return attachments or not. The default value is false. If includeAttachment is true, the basket api returns the attachments.  If the isloggedin flag is false,the basket api does not return the attachments.

Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

A flag which describes if the pricing should be run in createCart api. If price is true, it runs pricing on the created cart.  If price is false, it does not run pricing on the created cart. Default value is true.

A flag which describes if the validation should be run in createCart api. If validate is true, it runs validation on the created cart.  If validate is false, it does not run validation on the created cart. Default value is true.

request.description: Create a cart on Salesforce using a basket of configured items returned from one of the basket APIs.  This API adds all the requested items to the cart and configures them. The API will validate & price the  cart after bulk adding the items. In this version the API will always create an Order (not a quote or opportunity). It returns the Order Number of the created cart and a link to the /v2 API to retrieve the full cart contents.

description.content: The customer account id (Salesforce Id) for whom to create the cart.
The Catalog Code from which the customer is ordering. This defines the default price list to use for the cart.

Serialized form of the JSONResult format retrieved from a Basket API. This describes the items and configuration to add to the created cart.(Not required in v105 or higher, recommend to use cartContextKey instead)
the context key of the basket. If we pass this parameter, JSONResult parameter is not required.
assetReferenceKey returned in asset to basket. Required for baskets created from asset. Not required for draft baskets.

query.description: if isloggedin is not present in the api or isloggedin parameter value is false then, Context dimension values in the following format: dimension1:val1,dimension2:val2. Required if the context key or  account id are not provided. The key value pairs specify Context Dimension values that describe the  anonymous or known customer's "context" to be used in rule processing. If a value for any given context  dimension defined in the Vlocity Product Catalog is not provided, the default value specified on the Context  Dimension will be used to determine eligibility and pricing. if isloggedin is present in the api and isloggedin parameter value is set to true then, this parameter should have, accountId, contractId(optional), rootAssetIds(optional), example format for logged-in user context param : {"accountId":"idvalue", "contractId":"idvalue", "rootAssetIds": ["idvalue"]}

A flag which describes if the user is logged-in or anonymous.  If isloggedin flag is true, It indicates present api is used by a logged-in user, then we expect an accountId and a contractId in the context param of the api.  If the isloggedin flag is false or if this param is not specified, It indicates present api is used by an anonymous user

A flag which describes if the pricing should be run in createCart api. If price is true, it runs pricing on the created cart.  If price is false, it does not run pricing on the created cart. Default value is true.

A flag which describes if the validation should be run in createCart api. If validate is true, it runs validation on the created cart.  If validate is false, it does not run validation on the created cart. Default value is true.

request.description: Create a cart on Salesforce using a basket of configured items returned from one of the basket APIs.  This API adds all the requested items to the cart and configures them. The API will validate & price the  cart after bulk adding the items. In this version the API will always create an Order (not a quote or opportunity). It returns the Order Number of the created cart and a link to the /v2 API to retrieve the full cart contents.
